definition: front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
unprecedented and never to be duplicated/the first and the last/unmatched/unique

sentences.english: Since ancient times, many colorful banditry commotions more unprecedented.
sentences.chinese: 自古边关多匪患，骚动年代更空前。

sentences.english: He created the Persian Empire, one of the most splendid the world has ever seen.
sentences.chinese: 他建立了一个当时世界史上空前辉煌灿烂的波斯帝国。

sentences.english: This congress reflects the unprecedented unity of writers and artists throughout the country.
sentences.chinese: 这次大会，标志着全国文艺工作者的空前团结。

sentences.english: First, frequent high level visits consolidated the political basis of our relations.
sentences.chinese: 一是高层互访空前密切，中欧政治基础更加稳固。

sentences.english: Qin extinguishes six countries, has founded the unprecedented formidable centralization feudal empire.
sentences.chinese: 秦灭六国，建立了空前强大的中央集权的封建帝国。

sentences.english: The great change of society and history has helped to bring about the philosophy theory to be flourishing as never before.
sentences.chinese: 社会历史的伟大变革铸就了哲学理论的空前繁荣。

sentences.english: Never before has our country been as united as it is.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们的国家空前团结。
他的这一行动史无空前。

sentences.english: Renting is more popular than ever, even among the wealthy.
sentences.chinese: 即使是在富人圈子里，租房之风也空前盛行。

sentences.english: Honda sets all-time monthly record for production in China.
sentences.chinese: 本田在华产量创空前月度记录。

sentences.english: Veterans from around the world had surmounted one more unprecedented challenge.
sentences.chinese: 来自世界各地的退伍军人显然又是一个空前挑战。

sentences.english: China's industry is developing at an unprecedented rate.
sentences.chinese: 中国工业正以空前的速度发展。

sentences.english: This fiasco was worse than any of them, and seemed interminable.
sentences.chinese: 这最糟糕的八分钟是似乎是空前绝后的”。

sentences.english: The general mobilization of the population to work in the cotton fields is encouraged at the highest level, i. e. the Prime Minister's.
sentences.chinese: 动员大众到棉花地里工作受到了总理空前的鼓励。

sentences.english: Last year saw brands embracing innovative online video campaigns like never before.
sentences.chinese: 就在去年，各厂商纷纷拥抱创新视频营销，盛况空前。

sentences.english: Every goat year, waves of pilgrims come to the Holy Lake. It is really an exceptionally grand occasion.
sentences.chinese: 每逢羊年转湖的朝圣者人流如潮，盛况空前。

definition: unprecedented and never to be duplicated/the first and the last/unmatched/unique
to surge up/to rise/(of tensions etc) to run high
day by day/more and more/increasingly/more and more with each passing day
(increasing) day by day/(more critical) with every passing day/gradually
it is obvious that.../as one can well imagine...
the entire nation/the whole country, from the leadership to the rank and file
